author: Eleanor Warnock
title: Japan Unleashes Its Inner Slacker: Leave Work Early (Once a Month)
text:
TOKYO—Friday was a strange day for the head of Japan’s most important business group. 

Sadayuki Sakakibara, chairman of the Japan Business Federation, left the office at two in the afternoon, donned a plum-colored sport jacket and headed out to a department store with his wife, Emiko, in what husband and wife said was the first time in their married life they went shopping together on a weekday.
